result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin A. Barnhill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darrin A. Barnhill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darrin A. Barnhill was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:49 p.m. Defendant Darrin A. Barnhill in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees appearing specially. Calling 16cf323, 15cf109 and 15cf165. Voorhees states that defendant has a pending case and is represented by Cana Kohn - Voorhees states that defendant is requesting representation by PD. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 1. Schiek statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. 
Re: 15cf109 and 15cf165 - review of fines - Defendant states he was in emergency room on Monday morning - had someone call Clerk of Court's office. Defendant states he has $60 to set up payment plan today. Court will allow payment plan -- approves $50 monthly payment. Review hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:00 p.m. Court quashes warrants. Adj. 1:58 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
made VA - notified Brandi at ONSO - payment plan of $50/mo approved

2:53 p.m. Defendant Darrin A. Barnhill in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf109 and 15cf165. In 15cf109 - State moves to dismiss Count 2 - granted. In 15cf165 State moves to amend the single count of felony theft to 2 counts of misdemeanor theft - a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest pleas in both 15cf109 and 15cf165. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bail continued. Adj. 3:00 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:18 a.m. Defendant Darrin A. Barnhill in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf109 and 15cf165. Michlig states believes has resolution with exception of issue of restitution - Michlig has had numerous contacts with victims - received a "best guess estimate" faxed at 8:55 this morning - needs to clarify amounts. Burns agrees that resolution is close - plea questionaire was prepared but resitution is an issue. Bail continued. Adj. 9:23 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
